## 사건 정보

## 판결문 요약


193 Va. 411 (1952)
PLANTERS BANK AND TRUST COMPANY     NORMAN A. LOE AND ELVA LOE.
Record No. 3903.
Supreme Court of Virginia.
March 10, 1952.
Langhorne Jones    and    Hardee Chambliss, Jr.,    for the plaintiff in error.
Richardson, McCandlish & Lillard,    for the defendants in error.
Present, Hudgins, C.J., and Eggleston, Buchanan, Miller and Whittle, JJ.
1.  For the statute of frauds to apply to an oral promise to answer for the "debt, default, or misdoings" of another, it is essential that the oral promise be to perform the same duty or obligation which rests upon the other person.
2.  Plaintiffs contracted with a third party builder for the construction of a house.  Pursuant to the agreement, plaintiffs were to pay a given percentage at the commencement of the work, then specified amounts as the work progressed, and at the completion of the work defendant was to secure a mortgage for plaintiffs for the unpaid balance.  But before the house was completed, because of the builders financial inability to proceed, defendant bank agreed to loan plaintiffs funds to pay for the completion of the house upon the condition that defendant would pay the funds to the third party builder as the construction proceeded.  The builder was heavily indebted to defendant and that arrangement was entered into partly to protect defendant's interest and partly to enable the completion of the work.
